Package FileManager

Class FileManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • FileManager.FileManager
  • public class FileManager
extends java.lang.Object
    This is an input/output class that handles all of the dirty work in the read and write operations of the entity classes. It is instantiated in each entity class, and gets called by the read/write functions of all the entity classes.
    Since:
    2018-11-15
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Ng Man Chun

      FileManager()

    • Method Detail

      • readFile

        public static java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,​java.lang.String> readFile​(java.lang.String fileName)
        This method does the actual file access. It takes a file name as string and returns a HashMap containing the data in the file. Data is stored as properties in a plain text file, which helps with debugging.
        Parameters:
        fileName -
        Returns:
        HashMap of file data

      • writeFile

        public static void writeFile​(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,​java.lang.String> map,
                             java.lang.String fileName)
        This method does the actual file access. It takes some data as hashmap and a file name as string and writes it to the file. The data is stored as properties in a plain text file.
        Parameters:
        map -
        fileName -

      • compressMap

        public static java.lang.String compressMap​(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,​java.lang.String> map)
        This method takes a hash map and converts it into a string, with formatting similar to JSON. It is necessary because of hash map nesting with heterogeneous objects in the application- hashmaps can contain objects, string, or arrays of objects, so it is not possible to instantiate a nested hashmap. Our solution was to compress nested hashmaps to string so that when instantiating hashmaps, the data fields are always strings.
        Parameters:
        map -
        Returns:
        compressed map as string

      • compressMap

        public static java.lang.String compressMap​(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,​java.lang.String> map,
                                           boolean isArray)
        This method is the same as compressMap(String), but with some different string formatting to handle arrays of objects
        Parameters:
        map -
        isArray -
        Returns:
        compressed map as string

      • decompressMap

        public static java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,​java.lang.String> decompressMap​(java.lang.String mapString)
        This method takes a compressed hashmap in the form of string, and extracts data from it, returning the original hashmap
        Parameters:
        mapString -
        Returns:
        decompressed hashmap

      • decompressMap

        public static java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,​java.lang.String> decompressMap​(java.lang.String mapString,
                                                                                       boolean isArray)
        This method is same as decompressMap(String), but with different string formatting to handle object arrays.
        Parameters:
        mapString -
        isArray -
        Returns:

      • saveToFile

        public static void saveToFile​(int objID,
                              java.util.Map<java.lang.String,​java.lang.String> map,
                              java.lang.String fileName,
                              java.lang.String listFileName)
        This method is called by each entity class to handle writing to file. It handles all of the hashmap compression necessary and updates the listFile which contains a list of all the names of objects stored in the main file. The method is separate from the actual read/write to the main file because originally I/O was handled by JSON in our application During the conversion from JSON to plain java read/write we simply wrote new methods to handle the file access.
        Parameters:
        objID -
        map -
        fileName -
        listFileName -

      • saveToFile

        public static void saveToFile​(int objID1,
                              int objID2,
                              java.util.Map<java.lang.String,​java.lang.String> map,
                              java.lang.String fileName,
                              java.lang.String listFileName)
        This method is an overloaded version of saveToFile(int, Map, String, String). It handles cases where two objects with some relation need to be stored together (i.e. entries for registration and marks)
        Parameters:
        objID1 -
        objID2 -
        map -
        fileName -
        listFileName -

      • editFile

        public static void editFile​(int objID,
                            java.util.Map<java.lang.String,​java.lang.String> map,
                            java.lang.String fileName,
                            java.lang.String listFileName)
        This method handles editing an object in file. It takes a new map containing modified data of the object and fully overwrites the original data.
        Parameters:
        objID -
        map -
        fileName -
        listFileName -

      • deleteInFile

        public static void deleteInFile​(int objID,
                                java.lang.String fileName,
                                java.lang.String listFileName)
        This method deletes an object in the file. It then updates the listFile (which contains a list of all objects stored).
        Parameters:
        objID -
        fileName -
        listFileName -

      • deleteInFile

        public static void deleteInFile​(int objID1,
                                int objID2,
                                java.lang.String fileName,
                                java.lang.String listFileName)
        This method is an overloaded version of deleteInFile(int, String, String). It handles cases where one data entry in file containing two related objects need to be deleted (i.e. entries in registration and marks).
        Parameters:
        objID1 -
        objID2 -
        fileName -
        listFileName -

      • accessFile

        public static java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,​java.lang.String> accessFile​(int objID1,
                                                                                    int objID2,
                                                                                    java.lang.String fileName)
        This method is an overloaded version of accessFile(int, String). It handles cases where the entry that the user wants to read contains two related objects.
        Parameters:
        objID1 -
        objID2 -
        fileName -
        Returns:
        objects data as hashmap
